item.title: [Function]FindAObject
item.dc:creator: @Avaphi Avaphi
item.description:
@Avaphi wrote:

Here it is, It is atm, untested, but imho, I think it will be hawt. Here it is:

[code=pascal]//Find A Object\
program FindAObject;
{.include Srl\Srl.Scar}

Function FindAObject(S1, S2, S3 : String; Color1, Color2, Color3, Color4, Color5, Tolerance : integer): Boolean;
var i, Ax, Ay : Integer;//******Create iterating variable and X,y’s
var Colors: Array[1…5] of Integer;

begin//Beginning Function
Colors[1] := Color1;//Filling Array full of colors
Colors[2] := Color2;
Colors[3] := Color3;
Colors[4] := Color4;
Colors[5] := Color5;

for i := 1 to 5 do//Starting loop
begin
if FindColorSpiralTolerance(Ax, Ay, Colors[i], MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2, Tolerance) then
MMouse(Ax, Ay, 0, 0);
if IsUpTextMulti(S1, S2, S3) then
begin
writeln(‘We found the correct object ! Z0mg!’);
Mouse(Ax, Ay, 0, 0, True);
end;
writeln(‘We got fux0rd, Someone contact Avaphi !’);
end;

begin
SetupSrl;
If(FindAObject(‘Your’, ‘Strings’, ‘Here!’, hawtcolor1, hawtcolor2, hawtcolor3, hawtcolor4, hawtcolor5, Tol))Then
begin
writeln(‘I found the object dood’);
end;
end.
[/code]

Got any questions? Just ask

NOTES: You need to change the arguments of the function in the main loop(the hawtcolors, the strings and the tol argument) if you want to use it.

Read full topic
